description.para: A property Property_map<Type> allows to associate properties of type Type to a point.
Properties can be added, looked up with a string and removed at runtime.

briefdescription.para: Model of LvaluePropertyMap with Index as a key type and Type as value type.
tests whether property name of type T already exists.

memberdef.definition: std::pair< Property_map< T >, bool > CGAL::Point_set_3< Point, Vector >::add_property_map
memberdef.name: add_property_map

briefdescription.para: adds a new property name of type T with given default value.

parameterdescription.para: Value taken by the property on already created elements.

simplesect.para: Returns a pair containing the property map and a Boolean that is true if the property was added and false if it already exists (and was therefore not added but only returned).

memberdef.definition: std::optional< Property_map< T > > CGAL::Point_set_3< Point, Vector >::property_map
memberdef.name: property_map

briefdescription.para: returns the property name of type T.

simplesect.para: Returns an optional property map (empty if the property was not found).

briefdescription.para: removes the specified property.

simplesect.para: Returns true if the property was removed and false if the property was not found.

briefdescription.para: Convenience method that tests whether the point set has normals.

detaileddescription.para: This method tests whether a property of type Vector and named normal exists.

memberdef.definition: std::pair< Vector_map, bool > CGAL::Point_set_3< Point, Vector >::add_normal_map
memberdef.name: add_normal_map

briefdescription.para: Convenience method that adds a normal property.

detaileddescription.para: This method adds a property of type Vector and named normal.

simplesect.para: Returns a pair containing the normal map and a Boolean that is true if the property was added and false if it already exists (and was therefore not added but only returned).

briefdescription.para: returns the property map of the normal property.

simplesect.para: If the normal property has not been added yet to the point set before calling this method, the property map is automatically added with add_normal_map().

briefdescription.para: returns the property map of the normal property (constant version).

simplesect.para: The normal property must have been added to the point set before calling this method (see add_normal_map()).

briefdescription.para: Convenience method that removes the normal property.

simplesect.para: Returns true if the property was removed and false if the property was not found.

briefdescription.para: returns the property map of the point property.
returns the property map of the point property (constant version).
Copies the properties from another point set.

detaileddescription.para: All properties from other that do not already exist in this point set are added and filled to their default values. Properties that exist in both point sets are left unchanged.

briefdescription.para: returns a vector with all strings that describe properties.

memberdef.definition: std::vector< std::pair< std::string, std::type_index > > CGAL::Point_set_3< Point, Vector >::properties_and_types
memberdef.name: properties_and_types

briefdescription.para: returns a vector of pairs that describe properties and associated types.
returns a sequence of Named Parameters to be used in Point Set Processing algorithms.

detaileddescription.para:
The following named parameters are used:
point_map: contains the point property map (see point_map())
normal_map: contains the normal map (see normal_map())
geom_traits: contains the kernel typename Kernel_traits<Point>::Kernel

simplesect.para: this method does not check if the normal map was instantiated or not. The normal map named parameter should not be used if this property was not instantiated first.

briefdescription.para: Model of ConstRange that handles constant ranges for property maps with value type Type.
returns a property as a range.
returns a constant range of points.
returns a constant range of normals.

description.para: The following method are specifically designed to make CGAL::Point_set_3 usable with CGAL input/output functions.

briefdescription.para: This is an advanced type.

detaileddescription.para: Model of OutputIterator used to insert elements by defining the value of the property Property.

briefdescription.para: This is an advanced type.

detaileddescription.para: Model of WritablePropertyMap based on Property and that is allowed to push new items to the point set if needed.

briefdescription.para: This is an advanced type.

detaileddescription.para: Back inserter on indices

briefdescription.para: This is an advanced type.

detaileddescription.para: Back inserter on points

briefdescription.para: This is an advanced type.

detaileddescription.para: Property map for pushing new points

briefdescription.para: This is an advanced type.

detaileddescription.para: Property map for pushing new vectors

memberdef.definition: Push_property_map< Property_map< T > > CGAL::Point_set_3< Point, Vector >::push_property_map
memberdef.name: push_property_map

briefdescription.para: This is an advanced function.

detaileddescription.para: returns the push property map of the given property.

simplesect.para: Returns a pair containing: the specified property map and a Boolean set to true or an empty property map and a Boolean set to false (if the property was not found).

briefdescription.para: This is an advanced function.

detaileddescription.para: returns the push property map of the point property.

briefdescription.para: This is an advanced function.

detaileddescription.para: returns the push property map of the normal property.

simplesect.para: The normal property must have been added to the point set before calling this method (see add_normal_map()).

briefdescription.para: This is an advanced function.

detaileddescription.para: returns the back inserter on the index property.

briefdescription.para: This is an advanced function.

detaileddescription.para: returns the back inserter on the point property.

briefdescription.para: creates an empty point set with no additional property.

parameterdescription.para: true if the normal map should be added. If false (default value), the normal map can still be added later on (see add_normal_map()).

briefdescription.para: Assignment operator, all properties with their content are copied.
returns true if the number of elements not marked as removed is 0, false otherwise.

simplesect.para: This does not count the removed elements.
The method empty() is also available (see Range) and does the same thing.

briefdescription.para: returns the number of elements (not counting elements marked as removed).

simplesect.para: See number_of_removed_points() for getting the number of elements marked as removed.
The method size() is also available (see Range) and does the same thing.

briefdescription.para: merges other in the point set.

detaileddescription.para: Shifts the indices of points of other by number_of_points() + other.number_of_points().
Copies entries of all property maps which have the same name in the point set and other. Property maps which are only in other are ignored.

simplesect.para: If copy_properties() with other as argument is called before calling this method, then all the content of other will be copied and no property will be lost in the process.
Garbage is collected in both point sets when calling this method.

briefdescription.para: Clears the point set properties and content.

detaileddescription.para: After calling this method, the object is the same as a newly constructed object. The additional properties (such as normal vectors) are also removed and must thus be re-added if needed.

briefdescription.para: Clears all properties created.

detaileddescription.para: After calling this method, all properties are removed. The points are left unchanged.

briefdescription.para: increases the capacity of internal containers to be able to efficiently accommodate at least s elements

simplesect.para: This method does not change the content of the point set and is only used for optimization.

briefdescription.para: changes size of the point set.

parameterdescription.para: Target size of the point set

simplesect.para: If the given size is larger than the current size, the capacity of the internal container is extended. If there are element marked as removed, they may be overwritten. If the given size is smaller than the current size, garbage is collected and the container is resized.

briefdescription.para: inserts a new element with default property values.

simplesect.para: The iterator on the newly added element.

If a reallocation happens, all iterators, pointers and references related to the container are invalidated. Otherwise, only the end iterator is invalidated, and all iterators, pointers and references to elements are guaranteed to keep referring to the same elements they were referring to before the call.

briefdescription.para: inserts new point with default property values.

simplesect.para: Properties of the added point are initialized to their default value.

If a reallocation happens, all iterators, pointers and references related to the container are invalidated. Otherwise, only the end iterator is invalidated, and all iterators, pointers and references to elements are guaranteed to keep referring to the same elements they were referring to before the call.
The iterator on the newly added element.

briefdescription.para: Convenience method to add a point with a normal vector.

simplesect.para: Properties of the added point other than its normal vector are initialized to their default value.
If not already added, a normal property is automatically added to the point set when using this method. The default value for normal vectors is CGAL::NULL_VECTOR.

If a reallocation happens, all iterators, pointers and references related to the container are invalidated. Otherwise, only the end iterator is invalidated, and all iterators, pointers and references to elements are guaranteed to keep referring to the same elements they were referring to before the call.
The iterator on the newly added element.

briefdescription.para: Convenience method to copy a point with all its properties from another point set.

detaileddescription.para: In the case where two point sets have the same properties, this method allows the user to easily copy one point (along with the values of all its properties) from one point set to another.

parameterdescription.para: Point set to which the point to copy belongs
Index of the point to copy in other

simplesect.para: This point set and other must have the exact same properties, with the exact same names and types in the exact same order.

If a reallocation happens, all iterators, pointers and references related to the container are invalidated. Otherwise, only the end iterator is invalidated, and all iterators, pointers and references to elements are guaranteed to keep referring to the same elements they were referring to before the call.
The iterator on the newly added element.

briefdescription.para: returns the begin iterator.
returns the past-the-end iterator.

simplesect.para: The returned value is the same as garbage_begin().

briefdescription.para: returns the begin constant iterator.
returns the past-the-end constant iterator.

simplesect.para: The returned value is the same as garbage_begin().

briefdescription.para: returns a reference to the point corresponding to index.
returns a constant reference to the point corresponding to index.
returns a reference to the normal corresponding to index.

simplesect.para: If not already added, a normal property is automatically added to the point set (see add_normal_map()).

briefdescription.para: returns a constant reference to the normal corresponding to index.

simplesect.para: If not already added, a normal property is automatically added to the point set (see add_normal_map()).

briefdescription.para: marks all elements between first and last as removed.

simplesect.para: The elements are just marked as removed and are not erased from the memory. collect_garbage() should be called if the memory needs to be disallocated. Elements can be recovered with cancel_removals().
All iterators, pointers and references related to the container are invalidated.

briefdescription.para: marks element specified by iterator as removed.

simplesect.para: The element is just marked as removed and is not erased from the memory. collect_garbage() should be called if the memory needs to be freed. The element can be recovered with cancel_removals().
The end() iterator is invalidated, it dereferences to a different element.

briefdescription.para: marks element specified by Index as removed.

simplesect.para: The element is just marked as removed and is not erased from the memory. collect_garbage() should be called if the memory needs to be freed. The element can be recovered with cancel_removals().
The end() iterator is invalidated, it dereferences to a different element.

briefdescription.para: returns true if the element is marked as removed, false otherwise.

simplesect.para: When iterating between begin() and end(), no element marked as removed can be found.

briefdescription.para: returns true if the element is marked as removed, false otherwise.

simplesect.para: When iterating between begin() and end(), no element marked as removed can be found.

briefdescription.para: returns the constant iterator to the first element marked as removed (equal to garbage_end() if no elements are marked as removed.
returns the past-the-end constant iterator of the elements marked as removed.
Number of removed points.
Number of removed points.
returns true if there are elements marked as removed, false otherwise.
erases from memory the elements marked as removed.
restores all removed points.

detaileddescription.para: After removing one or several points, calling this method restores the point set to its initial state: points that were removed (and their associated properties) are restored.

simplesect.para: This method is only guaranteed to work if no point was inserted after the removal: otherwise, some points might not be restored.
If collect_garbage() was called after removal, the points are irremediably lost and nothing will be restored.

briefdescription.para: The point type.
The vector type.
Iterator type of the point set with value type Index is model of RandomAccessIterator
Constant iterator type of the point set with value type Index is model of RandomAccessIterator
Property map of points.
Property map of vectors.
Constant range of points.
Constant range of vectors.
Append other at the end of ps.

detaileddescription.para: Shifts the indices of points of other by ps.number_of_points() + other.number_of_points().
Copies entries of all property maps which have the same name in ps and other. Property maps which are only in other are ignored.

simplesect.para: Garbage is collected in both point sets when calling this method.

briefdescription.para: reads the point set from an input stream.

detaileddescription.para:
Supported file formats are the following:
Object File Format (OFF) (.off)
Polygon File Format (PLY) (.ply)
LAS (Lidar) File Format (.las)
XYZ File Format (.xyz)
The format is detected from the stream. If the stream contains normal vectors, the normal map is added to the point set. For PLY input, all point properties found in the header are added.

simplesect.para: To read a binary file, the flag std::ios::binary must be set during the creation of the ifstream.

briefdescription.para: writes the point set in an output stream in the Polygon File Format (PLY).

detaileddescription.para: All properties are inserted in their instantiation order.

simplesect.para: To write to a binary file, the flag std::ios::binary must be set during the creation of the ofstream, and the IO::Mode of the stream must be set to BINARY.

briefdescription.para: A collection of points with dynamically associated properties.

detaileddescription.para: An instance of this class stores a set of indices of type Index, each representing a point. Properties can be associated to each point and can be retrieved using the index of the point. There are two particular properties that are hard coded by this class: the coordinates of the points and the normal vectors.

The coordinates of a point can be accessed using the index of the point and the member function point(). This property is always present. The normal vector of a point can be accessed using the index of the point and the normal() method. This property must be explicitly created.
All properties can be accessed as a range using the methods points(), normals(), and range() for point coordinates, normal vectors, and other properties respectively.

Removing a point with properties is achieved by moving its index at the end of the container and keeping track of the number of removed elements. A garbage collection method must be called to really remove it from memory.
For convenience, all functions of the package Point Set Processing automatically create the right named parameters if called with a CGAL::Point_set_3 object as argument.
